video.title: Dancing on the Edge
video.synopsis: This miniseries follows the Louis Lester Band, a group of black jazz musicians who became darlings of English society in the 1930s.

episodes.synopsis: A journalist befriends jazz band musicians and helps them rise to fame in an era where their audiences have never heard black musicians play before.
episodes.title: Episode 1

episodes.synopsis: Stuck playing children's birthday parties, the band grows increasingly frustrated. But their fortune may change when they meet a wealthy recluse.
episodes.title: Episode 2

episodes.synopsis: When Jessie is attacked, the police question Louis. The band is devastated, but agrees to play a Christmas lunch gig without her.
episodes.title: Episode 3

episodes.synopsis: After the band plays at the funeral, the police haul Louis off to the station for questioning, leaving him confused about what he witnessed.
episodes.title: Episode 4

episodes.synopsis: Masterson offers a large reward for Louis, the prime suspect in Jessie's murder. Louis hides out with Stanley while plotting his escape from England.
episodes.title: Episode 5

episodes.synopsis: Stanley Mitchell interviews Louis Lester's band of musicians, who broke the color barrier in London -- making both friends and enemies in the process.
episodes.title: Episode 6
